images.description: Birds are feathered animals with beaks and wings, known for their ability to fly and diverse appearances.
Cheetahs are fast, slender, spotted big cats known for their incredible speed, reaching up to 60-70 mph in short bursts to catch prey on open plains.
Elephants are large, intelligent mammals with trunks, tusks, and massive bodies, known for their strong social bonds and impressive memory.
Frogs are small, tailless amphibians with smooth skin, long legs for jumping, and a life cycle that includes both aquatic and terrestrial stages.
Giraffes are tall mammals with long necks, spotted coats, and long legs, known for browsing treetops in African savannas.
Kangaroos are large marsupials with powerful hind legs, strong tails, and pouches for carrying their young, known for their unique hopping locomotion across Australia's landscapes.
Lions are large, social big cats with tawny coats and, in males, a distinctive mane; they are powerful hunters and live in prides on African grasslands.
Monkeys are intelligent, agile primates with long tails and dexterous hands, often living in social groups and displaying complex behaviors in forests and tropical regions.
Pandas are large, gentle bears with distinctive black-and-white fur, primarily known for their love of bamboo and native habitats in the forests of China.
Zebras are striped herbivorous mammals related to horses, known for their unique black-and-white coats and social behavior in herds across African grasslands.
